entities.name: mad-eye moody
entities.description: Mad-Eye Moody is a character in the story who has a magical eye that can see out of the back of his head. He is described as having a low and gravelly voice.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a person who is being spoken to by Mad-Eye Moody. He says he was missed by Moody's magical eye.

relationships.description: Mad-Eye Moody spoke to Harry, asking if he got him.
Moody warned Crabbe not to attack when his opponent's back is turned.
Moody also warned Goyle, implying that he should not attack either.
Moody pointed his wand at the ferret, which was trying to escape.
